name: Inserting Sample Data For Reports for the mont of June 2025 Data
Gas Alert Check
Extract Gas Level
func:
msg.payload = msg.payload.gas_level;
return msg;

name: Split Sensor Data
Extract Bedroom Temprature
Extract Hall Motion
Hall Temprature
Extract Toilet Motion
DB Error Handler
Prepare System Events Insertion Data
Prepare Sensors Reading Insertion Data
Prepare device status Insertion Data
Dashboard
info:
This group presents the Dashboard nodes:
1.

name: Prepare Motion Detuction Insertion Data
Hall Humidity
func:
msg.payload = msg.payload.hall_humi;
return msg;

name: Extract Bedroom Humidity
func:
msg.payload = msg.payload.bedroom_humi;
return msg;

name: Extract Light Level
func:
msg.payload = msg.payload.light_level;
return msg;

name: Door Status
label: Door Status
className: Door: {{msg.payload}}

name: Door Status
func:
msg.payload = msg.payload.status;
return msg;

name: Door distance
func:
msg.payload = msg.payload.distance;
return msg;

name: function 2
func:
msg.payload=msg.payload.status_ind;
return msg;

name: Gas Alert Panel
format:
GAS LEVEL: {{msg.payload}}

CRITICAL! EXHAUST FAN ACTIVATED
NORMAL LEVEL

name: Fetch All Device Status Data
Fetcht DataBase Schema
Preparaing Schem Query
Preparing Query to Drop Table
Fetch All Tables Data
Database Management
info:
This group consist of node to:
1. Create Schema (Create all Tables)
2. To Reset the schema (Drop all Tables)
3. fecthc data from all the Tables.
4. inserting a single record for testing.

name: Insert Sample Data
DB Error Handler 2

sql:
-- Sample System Events Data for Smart Home (June - July 2025)

-- Severity levels: 'low', 'medium', 'high', 'critical'

INSERT INTO system_events (timestamp, event_type, description, severity) VALUES

-- June 2025 Data - System operations and alerts
-- Early June - System startup and normal operations
('2025-06-01 00:00:15', 'system_startup', 'Smart home system initialized successfully', 'low'),
('2025-06-01 06:15:30', 'lighting_auto', 'Hall RGB activated by motion sensor - PIR1', 'low'),

sql:
-- Sample Device Status Data for Smart Home (June - July 2025)
-- Device names: 'bedroom_ac', 'exhaust_fan', 'hall_rgb', 'toilet_led', 'blinds_servo', 'buzzer', 'dht1_sensor', 'dht2_sensor', 'gas_sensor', 'door_sensor', 'pir1_hall', 'pir2_toilet', 'light_sensor', 'potentiometer'
-- Status: 'online', 'offline', 'active', 'inactive', 'standby', 'error', 'maintenance'
-- Value: Device-specific readings or states

INSERT INTO device_status (timestamp, device_name, status, value) VALUES

-- June 2025 Data - Device monitoring and status tracking
-- System startup - All devices initialization

name: Sample Device Status Data

sql:
SELECT timestamp, bedroom_temp, hall_temp 
FROM sensor_readings 
WHERE timestamp >= datetime('now', '-7 days')

name: Temprature History 24 H

sql:
SELECT timestamp, bedroom_temp, hall_temp 
FROM sensor_readings 
WHERE timestamp >= datetime('now', '-2 months')

name: Temprature History 24 H

sql:
SELECT strftime('%H', timestamp) as hour, location, COUNT(*) as count 
FROM motion_events 
--WHERE motion = 1 
--AND timestamp >= datetime('now', '-1 month') 
GROUP BY hour, location

name: Energy Consumption

sql:
SELECT 
    device_name AS device,
    status,
    value,
    strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M', timestamp) AS last_update
FROM device_status
WHERE id IN (
    SELECT MAX(id) 
    FROM device_status 
    GROUP BY device_name
)
ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
name: Fetch Device Status

sql:
SELECT timestamp, bedroom_temp, hall_temp 
FROM sensor_readings 
WHERE timestamp >= datetime('now', '-24 hours')

name: Temprature History 24 H
Motion History Month
Prepare SQLite Query for sensor_readings
Weekly Report Query
func:
msg.topic = `SELECT 
  strftime('%W', timestamp) as week,
  AVG(bedroom_temp) as avg_bed_temp,
  MAX(gas_level) as peak_gas,
  COUNT(CASE WHEN motion_hall=1 THEN 1 END) as hall_motion,
  COUNT(CASE WHEN door_status='open' THEN 1 END) as door_openings
FROM sensor_readings
GROUP BY week`;
return msg;

name: Fetch Device Status
Random Temperature Values
Random Temperature Values

sql:
SELECT 
    strftime('%H', timestamp) as hour, 
    location, 
    COUNT(*) as count 
FROM motion_events 
--WHERE motion = 1 AND 
--    timestamp >= datetime('now', '-1 month') 
GROUP BY hour, location
ORDER BY hour ASC;
